We wish her great happiness, health, and joy in retirement!

We highly encourage everyone to share a personal message to her on our page.

Attached is a video from her retirement celebration.

We have all been Inspired by HOW she made a difference to so many.

Dayton could not be more proud of the student-athletes that the Kentucky High School Athletic Association (KHSAA) recognized as 2019-2020 KHSAA Triple Threat Athletes. This is an honor that the KHSAA began to recognize just 4 years ago. To be considered a "Triple Threat", a student-athlete must be ALL of the following:

An athlete on a varsity roster for each of the 3 seasons recognized by the KHSAA -- This is fall, winter and spring. Student-athletes who are contributors for their school during the entire school year are a dying breed. TONS of student-athletes are choosing to specialize in 1 or 2 sports. Dayton has 17 Student-Athletes who gave their all - All Year to the Greendevils!! Thank you all!

We are blessed to call these kids ours!! Go, Devils!!

Dayton Community-
It is with great sadness that we report the loss of Mr. Bob Waxler to cancer.
Our thoughts and prayers are with his family, close friends, and of course his Food Service Family.
Bob was a Greendevil from the beginning. He was born and raised in Dayton and graduated from Dayton High School in 1971.
Bob was a great guy who embraced his role as a grandfather to many of our Little Devils and truly loved our kids.
We encourage any student who would like to make/send a card to Mr. Bob's family - please do so! You can drop off the cards to Lincoln Elementary School on packet pick-up day or mail the cards to Lincoln Elementary School (701 Fifth Ave, Dayton, KY 41074).
Mr. Bob - you may be gone, but will never be forgotten.
We love you!

April 3, 2020

Dayton School Community,

Yesterday, our Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear extended our NTI (Non-Traditional Instruction) for students through Friday, May 1.

We know this comes as a disappointment to many that our school buildings will be closed to instruction, but we all need to pull together to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. It is essential that we continue to support the governor‚Äôs ‚ÄúHealthy at Home‚Äù plan and do everything we can to prevent the spread of this virus. Even though our school buildings are closed, learning continues. We will continue to work together to Grow our students.

I am sure you have many questions concerning grades, report cards, graduation and more. Please know that I am working with our school leaders to develop a plan, and we will keep you informed as details become available.

Please continue to take care of yourself and others.

Jay Brewer
Superintendent of Dayton Independent Schools
